question: Respiratory system develops from:
exp: Respiratory system develops from: ventral wall of foregut.

question: Kaagener syndrome includes all of the following except:
exp: Kaagener syndrome includes situs inversus totalis, chronic sinusitis, and airway disease leading to bronchiectasis.

question: Most common type of foregut cysts are?
exp: Foregut cysts are abnormal detachments of primitive foregut most often located in hilum or middle mediastinum. 3 types: Bronchogenic (most common) Esophageal Enteric.

question: Blood supply of bronchogenic sequestration is:
exp: Bronchogenic sequestration refers to a discrete area of lung tissue that lacks any connection to the airway system. It has abnormal blood supply arising from aoa.
